name: "Bull" - The Pilot Multiple Choice Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: What business was Dr. Jason Bull in?
questions.explanation:
Jury Consulting.

	The series starred Michael Weatherly in his first role after leaving "NCIS". The company was called Trial Analysis Corporation. Weatherly played the titular character, who helped pick juries for his clients and helped to manipulate the jurors into picking his side of the case.

questions.text: Where was the dead woman found in the opening of the show?
questions.explanation:
On the beach.

	Several people were playing volleyball when the ball went flying toward the water. The woman who went to grab the ball saw the body washed up on shore.

questions.text: Who was the client in the pilot?
questions.explanation:
Brandon Peters.

	Brandon Peters was a billionaire's son. He was accused of killing a woman on his yacht. He hired five attorneys and Dr. Jason Bull's firm to help prove his innocence.

questions.text: What question did Bull had the defense team ask the jurors?
questions.correct: Why do you catch a cold?
questions.explanation:
Why do you catch a cold?.

	Bull himself wasn't an attorney, but he wrote questions down for the defense team to ask the jury pool.  Based on that question Bull was able to tell what type of outlook on life they had. None of the other questions were shown during the episode.

questions.text: Alyssa, the dead woman, was a drug dealer.
questions.explanation:
True.

	She sold Methamphetamine and later fake Molly. The defense discovered that just before the trial started, and used that when questioning Alyssa's mother.

questions.text: Brandon took photos of a girl tied up in his bed. What was her name?
questions.explanation:
Taylor.

	Brandon and Taylor were friends, but Brandon didn't see it as a sexual relationship. Taylor had sent a text message to Brandon that read "The bitch must die", prompting the lawyers to suggest in court that she was the one who may have committed the murder.

questions.text: There was a drive by shooting outside of the courthouse.
questions.explanation:
False.

	It was a "walk by" as no vehicle was involved.  Brandon's dad was hit, but not seriously injured. He was the only injury in the shooting. Several gunshots went off as court was breaking for the second day of the trial.

questions.text: Clyde, the lead attorney for Brandon, wanted to take a plea deal for what charge?
questions.explanation:
Second degree murder.

	Bull's team found out because they had bugged Clyde's watch. They listened is as he met with the prosecuting attorney. That's when Bull finally convinced Brandon to take the stand. The deal would have put Brandon in prison for 10 years.

questions.text: "I hate lawyers" was uttered by which character?
questions.explanation:
Bull.

	Ironic since he had to deal with lawyers every day as a trial consultant. Bull hated all of the lawyers, but often manipulated them in order to get the outcome he wanted as well.

questions.text: Brandon was found innocent at the end.
questions.explanation:
true.

	After taking the stand, acquitted. Brandon managed to convince the jury of his innocence by revealing that he was gay, and was off with another man the night Alyssa was murdered. Adele Bensimon, Taylor's mother was arrested for the murder at the end of the episode.
